sentences.en: An idle whim, I fear, sir,' was my answer; `or else an idle whim is going to spirit me away.
sentences.cn: “恐怕是一种无聊的奇想，先生，”这是我的回答，“不然就是一种无聊的奇想又要诱使我走开。

sentences.en: Dozens of servants had catered to his every whim.
sentences.cn: 几十个仆人迎合他所有稀奇古怪的念头。

sentences.en: Everyone was entirely subject to the whim of the Sultan.
sentences.cn: 所有人都完全听命于苏丹王,由着他随心所欲.

sentences.en: He had a sudden whim to go sailing today.
sentences.cn: 今天他突然想要去航海.

sentences.en: He panders to her every whim.
sentences.cn: 他对她的性子百依百顺.

sentences.en: He picked people on a whim, without rhyme or reason.
sentences.cn: 他选人时总是随心所欲，毫无根据。

sentences.en: He was forced to pander to her every whim .
sentences.cn: 她每次心血来潮他都不得不依随她。

sentences.en: I bought the encyclopedia on a whim.
sentences.cn: 我凭一时的兴致买了这本百科全书.

sentences.en: I had a sudden whim to take a walk.

sentences.cn: 那不过是我一时的高兴就是了.

sentences.en: Lately, the president has been sacking and picking new ministers at whim.
sentences.cn: 最近，总统一时兴起频频解雇旧部长，选任新部长。

sentences.en: On arrival, she buys a glass factory on a whim, and challenges him to transport a church built entirely of glass by boat from Sydney 250 miles up the coast.
sentences.cn: 到达目的地后，她突发奇想买了一个玻璃厂，并向他挑战，让他用船沿着 250 英里长的海岸线从悉尼运来建造一整座玻璃教堂。

sentences.en: She bought that dress on a whim.
sentences.cn: 她一时心血来潮就买了那件连衣裙.

sentences.en: Slave girls prepared and served his food and drink and attended to his every whim.
sentences.cn: 侍女侍候他的饮食并满足他的各种欲望.

sentences.en: The premium can increase at the whim of the insurers.
sentences.cn: 保险公司可以随时提高保费。

sentences.en: Using a treeview to represent arbitrary objects organized in an arbitrary fashion at the whim of a programmer is asking for big trouble when it comes to usability.
sentences.cn: 程序员一时兴起以一种武断的方式来采用树形视图表现随意的对象，在可用性方面会遇到很大的问题。

sentences.en: We decided, more or less on a whim, to sail to Morocco.
sentences.cn: 我们多少有点心血来潮，决定航海去摩洛哥。

sentences.en: Whether or not it then gets the carrot depends on the whim of the mule driver.
sentences.cn: 那时候它是否吃得到这串萝卜,得看驴夫的高兴.

trans.tran_cn: 一时的兴致，突然的念头，怪念头，奇想，幻想
trans.tran_en: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason
